cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.DS, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the problem of multiplexing two sequences of messages over a packet erasure channel with different decoding delays. This problem is related to information theory (cs.IT) as it involves studying the capacity region of the channel. The paper also considers the use of streaming codes, which are commonly used in networked systems (cs.NI) and distributed systems (cs.DS). The paper proposes a new coding scheme that achieves the capacity region, which involves superimposing two single-stream codes, a technique that is commonly used in signal processing (cs.SI). Finally, the paper provides a theoretical analysis of the proposed coding scheme, which involves proving a converse bound, a technique commonly used in machine learning (cs.LG).
